thread.title: ‘Chicharon’ pork-crackers found in Khor Fakkan grocery store
thread.title_full: ‘Chicharon’ pork-crackers found in Khor Fakkan grocery store | GulfNews.com

author: Mariam M. Al Serkal, Senior Web Reporter
title: ‘Chicharon’ pork-crackers found in Khor Fakkan grocery store
text:
Dubai: A grocery store in Khor Fakkan is under investigation after the popular Chicharon crackers – a Filipino snack made of pig skin – were found on the shelves.
The municipality had initially received a complaint from a resident about snacks that seemed to have been made from pork derivatives.
“An investigation was immediately launched, and the product was taken for testing at the municipality’s laboratory,” said Fawzia Rashid Al Qadi, director of Khor Fakkan Municipality, who was Quote: d in local Arabic newspapers.
She explained that the prohibited food product was removed from the supermarket’s shelves and that strict action has been taken to ensure that the store do not sell the crackers again.
Al Qadi also said that action will be taken against the supplier, and that legal measures will be taken against violators who do not adhere to market regulations.
According to the UAE rules, pork products should only be sold in non-halal sections of supermarkets.
